The claim states that Donald Trump was: caught investing in (the) Dakota Pipeline before signing it." This aspect of the claim implies that Trump approved the pipeline for financial gain.
The expert: s verdict clarifies that Trump sold his shares in the pipeline parent company, Energy Transfer Partners, in the summer of 2016, before he had the power to approve the pipeline's construction. This aspect undermines the claim's implication that Trump approved the pipeline to profit from it, as he no longer held any financial stake in the company when he signed the executive action to restart the construction.
